metadata.title: CVE-2024-26990 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:KVM: x86/mmu: Write-protect L2 SPTEs in TDP MMU when clearing dirty statusCheck kvm_mmu_page_ad_need_write_protect() when deciding whether towrite-protect or clear D-bits on TDP MMU SPTEs, so that the TDP MMUaccounts for any role-specific reasons for disabling D-bit dirty logging.Specifically, TDP MMU SPTEs must be write-protected when the TDP MMU isbeing used to run an L2 (i.e. L1 has disabled EPT) and PML is enabled.KVM always disables PML when running L2, even when L1 and L2 GPAs are inthe some domain, so failing to write-protect TDP MMU SPTEs will causewrites made by L2 to not be reflected in the dirty log.[sean: massage shortlog and changelog, tweak ternary op formatting]
